step.context: \text{The relationship between a differential equation} \\ \text{and the curve (function) that it represents is}
step.reason: \text{If an equation (curve) is differentiated on both} \\ \text{sides with respect to a variable, the result is a} \\ \text{differential equation for the family of curves} \\ \text{that the equation is part of.} \\ \text{If }y=a\cdot f(x)+b, \text{and }f'(x)=g(x), \text{ then}\\ \begin{align} &\dfrac{dy}{dx}=a\cdot \dfrac{d}{dx}f(x)+0 \\ \implies &\dfrac{dy}{dx}=a\cdot g(x) \end{align} \\ \text{which is the differential equation.}

step.context: y=cx+c^2, \text{ differentiating} \\ \text{both sides with respect to x gives}
step.reason: \begin{align} y &= cx + c^2 \\ \dfrac{dy}{dx} &= \dfrac{d}{dx}cx + \dfrac{d}{dx}c^2 \\ \dfrac{dy}{dx} &= c \end{align} \\ \text{Substituting c in } y=cx+c^2, \\ \left(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\right)^2+x\dfrac{dy}{dx}-y=0 \\ \text{Note: }\left(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\right)^2\neq \dfrac{d^2y}{dx^2}
